# Rutgers Defeats USC 69-65 in 2025 Big Ten Tournament First Round

The 2025 Big Ten Tournament first-round matchup between the Rutgers Scarlet Knights and USC Trojans concluded with a 69-65 victory for Rutgers. This result, verified through live game trackers and post-game statistics, confirms the Scarlet Knights advanced to the next round of the tournament[4][11][12]. The game, held at Gainbridge Fieldhouse in Indianapolis on March 12, 2025, at 8:30 PM ET, featured a competitive second-half surge by Rutgers to overcome a halftime deficit and secure the win[4][12].

## Game Overview and Key Moments

### First Half Performance
USC entered halftime with a 41-30 lead, capitalizing on efficient scoring from guards Desmond Claude and Wesley Yates III. Claude, who had previously dropped 30 points in the teams’ February 23 matchup, spearheaded the Trojans’ early offensive efforts with 15 first-half points[1][7]. Rutgers’ freshman duo of Dylan Harper and Ace Bailey struggled initially, combining for just 12 points in the opening period amid tight defensive pressure from USC’s backcourt[4][12].

### Second Half Turnaround
The Scarlet Knights shifted momentum in the second half with a 14-2 run over a five-minute span, fueled by Harper’s playmaking and critical baskets from reserves Lathan Sommerville and Dylan Grant. Harper, who finished with a team-high 19 points, assisted on Grant’s go-ahead layup at the 3:17 mark to give Rutgers its first lead since the opening minutes[4][12]. Defensive adjustments by Rutgers head coach Steve Pikiell limited USC to 24 second-half points, including an 0-for-7 shooting drought during the final three minutes[12].

### Overtime Avoidance
With the score tied 63-63 at the 4:23 mark, Rutgers executed a methodical offensive sequence culminating in Sommerville’s mid-range jumper off an Ace Bailey assist. USC’s Chibuzo Agbo missed a potential game-tying three-pointer with 10 seconds remaining, sealing the Trojans’ fate[4][12]. The Scarlet Knights’ 11-2 advantage in bench scoring and 44 points in the paint proved decisive in overcoming USC’s perimeter-oriented attack[3][12].

## Statistical Analysis and Player Contributions

### Rutgers’ Balanced Attack
Dylan Harper’s 19-point, 5-assist performance anchored Rutgers’ offense, while Ace Bailey added 14 points and 9 rebounds. Reserve forward Lathan Sommerville provided a critical spark with 8 points and 4 rebounds in 18 minutes, including a momentum-shifting putback dunk in the second half[4][12]. The Scarlet Knights shot 47.4% from the field (27/57) despite connecting on just 4-of-19 three-point attempts[12].

### USC’s Standout Performers
Desmond Claude led all scorers with 22 points on 9-of-17 shooting, though his 6 turnovers hampered USC’s late-game execution. Transfer forward Rashaun Agee contributed 12 points and 7 rebounds, while guard Wesley Yates III added 15 points before fouling out with 2:14 remaining[4][12]. The Trojans’ 16 team turnovers led to 18 Rutgers points, offsetting their 38-34 advantage in rebounds[12].

## Implications for the Big Ten Tournament
With the win, Rutgers advances to face third-seeded Purdue in the second round, setting up a rematch of their March 6 regular-season finale where the Boilermakers won 100-71[1][7]. The Scarlet Knights’ ability to limit Purdue’s All-American center Will Edey will likely dictate their chances of advancing further. For USC, the loss concludes a disappointing 15-17 campaign marked by inconsistent defensive performances and an inability to close tight games[2][5][8].

recommendation: p1
